entities.name: MqttConnectOptions
entities.description: Options supplied when establishing an MQTT client connection to Mosquitto.

fields.name: clientId
fields.description: Unique client identifier (max 23 chars for MQTT 3.1).

fields.name: host
fields.description: Broker hostname or IP address.

fields.name: port
fields.description: Broker TCP port (default 1883, TLS 8883).

fields.name: keepalive
fields.description: Keep-alive interval in seconds.

fields.name: username
fields.description: MQTT username for authentication.

fields.name: password
fields.description: MQTT password for authentication.

fields.name: cleanSession
fields.description: Whether to start a clean session (discard queued messages).

fields.name: protocol
fields.description: MQTT protocol version: 3 (3.1), 4 (3.1.1), 5 (5.0).

fields.name: tlsEnabled
fields.description: Whether TLS is enabled for this connection.

entities.name: MqttMessage
entities.description: An MQTT message published to or received from Mosquitto.

fields.name: messageId
fields.description: Message identifier (0 for QoS 0 messages).

fields.name: topic
fields.description: Topic string the message is published to or received on.

fields.name: payload
fields.description: Raw message payload bytes.

fields.name: payloadLen
fields.description: Length of the payload in bytes.

fields.name: qos
fields.description: Quality of Service level: 0 (at most once), 1 (at least once), 2 (exactly once).

fields.name: retain
fields.description: Whether the broker retains this message for new subscribers.

entities.name: MqttSubscription
entities.description: A topic subscription registered with the Mosquitto broker.

fields.name: topicFilter
fields.description: Topic filter, may include + (single-level) or # (multi-level) wildcards.

fields.name: qos
fields.description: Maximum QoS level at which messages are delivered to this subscriber.

fields.name: noLocal
fields.description: MQTT 5 — if true, messages from this client are not echoed back.

fields.name: retainAsPublished
fields.description: MQTT 5 — retain flag in forwarded messages matches original.

fields.name: retainHandling
fields.description: MQTT 5 — controls delivery of retained messages on subscribe.

fields.name: listenPort
fields.description: TCP port to listen on (default 1883).

fields.name: maxConnections
fields.description: Maximum number of simultaneous client connections.

fields.name: persistenceEnabled
fields.description: Whether subscription and message data is persisted to disk.

fields.name: persistenceFile
fields.description: Path to the persistence database file.

fields.name: aclFile
fields.description: Path to the access-control-list file.

fields.name: passwordFile
fields.description: Path to the password file for username/password auth.

fields.name: tlsCaFile
fields.description: CA certificate file for TLS.

fields.name: tlsCertFile
fields.description: Server certificate file for TLS.

fields.name: tlsKeyFile
fields.description: Server private key file for TLS.

fields.name: logLevel
fields.description: Log verbosity: none, info, notice, warning, err, debug, all.

entities.name: MqttSession
entities.description: Active broker-side session state for a connected MQTT client.

fields.name: clientId
fields.description: Client identifier for this session.

fields.name: connected
fields.description: Whether the client is currently connected.

fields.name: cleanSession
fields.description: Whether the session is non-persistent.

fields.name: keepalive
fields.description: Negotiated keep-alive in seconds.

fields.name: subscriptions
fields.description: Current subscriptions held by this session.

relationships.notes: A published message is delivered to all subscriptions whose topic filter matches the message topic.
Each session holds zero or more active subscriptions.
A session is established via connect options.

lifecycles.notes: Mosquitto client session lifecycle; transitions driven by CONNECT/DISCONNECT/keep-alive timeout.

idempotency.notes: Reconnection re-creates the TCP session; not idempotent.
QoS 2 ensures exactly-once delivery but is not idempotent at the API level.
Re-subscribing with the same filter is safe; broker updates QoS if different.
Unsubscribing a non-existent filter is a no-op.
Disconnecting an already-disconnected client is harmless.

events.name: message.received
events.notes: Delivered to all matching subscribers as a DDS-style push stream.

events.name: client.connected
events.notes: Broker-side event when a client successfully connects (available via $SYS topics).

events.name: client.disconnected
events.notes: Broker-side event when a client disconnects (available via $SYS topics).

customFields.notes: MQTT 5 user-properties extend messages but are not schema-defined.
